item.title: Advanced Data Visualization with R and ggplot2: Recreating the New York Times COVID Tracker
item.description: In a previous article, I mentioned the need to find mentors to enhance your ability to create clear, concise, and meaningful data visualizations. The New York Times is one example I highly recommend you follow. They do an excellent job of creating information rich charts that are understandable to a wide variety of people. One example is their COVID 19 tacker. NYT New York COVID Tracker You may be thinking, sure, that chart looks great, but I have no idea how to create something like this.
